Detailed Description

Base-class for the class OptionalConfig. Defines enumerations for reserved group-IDs and settings-IDs.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum OptionalConfigBase::GroupIds
 

A group ID summarizes settings. The group ID and the settings ID allow to access a unique settings value.

Enumerator:
Display 
Editor 
Keyboard 
Locale 
Theme 
GuiEngine 
Custom 

enum OptionalConfigBase::SettingIds
 

Each setting ID belongs to a group ID. The group ID and the settings ID allow to access a unique settings value.

Enumerator:
DimmedBacklightBrightness 
ScrollbarAlignment  Defines alignment of the scrollbar: 0 means scrollbar always on the right, 1 means scrollbar always on the left. It is recommmended to let APOXI decide the alignment dependant from the current used language: right for e. g. English, left for e. g. Arabic. If this is wanted, just don't specify any scrollbar alignment.
ScrollbarDisplayPolicy  Defines the display-policy of the scrollbar: 0 means, that the scrollbar is only displayed, if the number of visible items is smaller than the number of current items (= default). 1 means, that the scrollbar is displayed always and 2 means, that the scrollbar is never displayed.
MaxDecoderDelay  Defines the maximum delay of image decoders in milliseconds: When decoding large images the decoding might need some seconds. To give the user a visual response about the progress, the display is updated when the decoding exceeds the maximum delay. Hence if the maximum delay is set to 500 and the decoding of an images needs 2 seconds, the display is updated 4 times to show the current progress. The default value is 500 milliseconds.
ScrollGap  Defines the gap between the selection and the top/bottom of a scrollable area, where the scrolling should start. Per default the a gap of 0 is used, which means that the scrolling starts after the selection reaches the top/bottom of a scrollable area. The gap is only respected when using the scrollbehaviors DefaultBehavior or RotateBehavior, which may be specified by GuiEngineConfig::GetScrollBehavior(). A gap of -1 indicates, that the selection should always be centered vertically. Using -1 only works with the EndlessLoopBehavior, otherwise the gap will be ignored.
HideClippedText  Hides the text of an item, if it is clipped at the bottom of an ItemTree, ItemMenu or ItemList. 0 means that the text is not hidden and clipped (= default), 1 hides the text. Note that enabling this option should not be necessary if the sizes of the fonts are chosen well. Having an empty space instead of a clipped text does not automatically lead to a well designed screen layout, so enabling this option just hides a weak designed screen layout.
SmoothScrollSteps  Defines the number of steps which should be used for scrolling between two points. A higher value means a smoother scrolling but also might decrease the performance. The default setting 3 is used if no value is set.
MaxEncoderDelay  Delay in milliseconds until the encoder sends a ImageEncodingProgressMsg to the system.
HorizontalScrollBehavior  Defines the scrollbehavior for controls which allow horizontal scrolling (e. g. the TabControl). If 0 is returned, a cyclic scrolling is done (= default). If 1 is returned, reaching the left or right border does not lead to any scrolling.
TabButtonDefaultHeight  Defines the default width of a tab button. This parameter is only used by the DefaultTheme. When implementing a custom theme it might be an alternative option to hardcode this value in the TabButtonView implementation.
TabButtonDefaultWidth  Defines the default width of a tab button. This parameter is only used by the DefaultTheme. When implementing a custom theme it might be an alternative option to hardcode this value in the TabButtonView implementation.
TabButtonMinimumWidth  Defines the minimum width of a tab button. This parameter is only used by the DefaultTheme. When implementing a custom theme it might be an alternative option to hardcode this value in the TabButtonView implementation.
TabButtonMaximumWidth  Defines the maximum width of a tab button. This parameter is only used by the DefaultTheme. When implementing a custom theme it might be an alternative option to hardcode this value in the TabButtonView implementation.
TabButtonClippedWidth  If not all tab buttons fit into the tab control width, TabButtonClippedWidth describes the preferred width of the clipped tab button on the left or right. This parameter is only used by the DefaultTheme. When implementing a custom theme it might be an alternative option to hardcode this value in the TabButtonView implementation.
ShowParentPosition  Defines whether the parent position of an item menu should be shown in the upper right corner of a window (the feature APOXI_ENABLE_POSITION_PREVIEW must be enabled). If 0 is returned, only the position of the currently selected item is shown (= default value). If 1 is returned, the parent position will be shown too. The separator of the positions can be defined also in the class OptionalConfig by the parameter SettingIds::PositionSeparator.
PositionSeparator  Defines the separator which is used between position indicators (see SettingIds::ShowParentPosition). The returned value must be encoded in UCS-2 (e. g. use static_cast<INT>(L'/') for returning a '/' as separator. Per default a '.' is used as separator.
SelectionStyle  Defines the default selection style of the editors. If 0 is returned, the selection style AbstractEditor::InvertedSelection is used (= default setting). If 1 is returned, the selection style AbstractEditor::TransparentSelection is used.
